alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Hoke; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 6:21PM EDT until July 05 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Cumberland, Hoke and Scotland. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville, Raeford, Antioch, Hope Mills, Wagram, Rockfish, Silver City, Bowmore, Vander, Cedar Creek, Bushy Lake Natural Area and Sandhills Game Land. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Blounts Creek near Robeson St, Little Rockfish Creek in Hope Mills, Big Sandy Run at US-301 south of Fayetteville, Hope Mills Rd and Camden Rd, Rockfish Rd at Gully Branch, and Puppy Creek near US-401.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads.
